question: [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: db_dir] [Path Traversal] Can an attacker provide a malicious db_dir path using '../../../' sequences to access databases outside the intended directory, potentially exposing sensitive blockchain data from other nodes or system files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: db_dir] [Symbolic Link Attack] Can an attacker create a symbolic link in the db_dir path that points to a sensitive system directory, allowing unauthorized read access to validator private keys or system configuration files when the tool opens the database? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: db_dir] [Race Condition/TOCTOU] Can an attacker exploit a time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerability by swapping the db_dir target between validation and database opening, redirecting the tool to read from a malicious or sensitive database location? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: db_dir] [Information Disclosure] Does the tool validate that db_dir points to a valid AptosDB database before opening, or can it be pointed to arbitrary RocksDB databases containing sensitive information from other applications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: db_dir] [Access Control Bypass] Can an unprivileged user run this tool against a production validator database while it's in use, potentially exposing consensus-critical information or validator secrets if they're stored in the database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: version] [Integer Overflow] Can providing u64::MAX or extremely large version numbers cause integer overflow in downstream database queries (get_transaction, get_events_by_version), potentially triggering panics or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: version] [Out-of-Bounds Access] Does the tool validate that the requested version exists in the database before querying, or can specifying a future version number cause the database layer to return uninitialized memory or corrupt data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: version] [Information Disclosure] Can an attacker use version=0 or version=1 to retrieve genesis transaction data that might contain sensitive initialization parameters, validator identities, or initial token distributions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: version] [Pruning Bypass] If the database has been pruned to remove old versions, can specifying a pruned version number trigger error messages that leak information about the pruning configuration or historical transaction data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: sharding_config] [Configuration Mismatch] Can an attacker specify enable_storage_sharding=true when the database was created with sharding disabled (or vice versa), causing the tool to read from wrong database shards and return corrupted or inconsistent data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 25-28] [State Corruption] Does the mismatch between actual database sharding and the sharding_config parameter cause silent data corruption where the tool reads state from wrong shards, potentially masking consensus bugs or storage corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Struct: Cmd, Field: sharding_config] [Denial of Service] Can toggling enable_storage_sharding repeatedly while the database is being accessed by other processes cause lock contention or file descriptor exhaustion, degrading validator performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 32-39] [Concurrent Access] Even though the database is opened with readonly=true, can concurrent writes from a running validator node cause data inconsistencies or crashes when this tool reads the same data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 32-39] [File Lock Bypass] Does opening in readonly mode properly acquire read locks, or can it bypass lock mechanisms allowing reads of partially-written data during validator commits, exposing intermediate states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 32-39] [Resource Exhaustion] Can multiple concurrent invocations of this tool exhaust file descriptors or memory by each opening the full database, potentially causing validator node crashes or degraded performance? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 29-30] [Cache Poisoning] By setting env=None and block_cache=None, does the tool create new cache instances that could interfere with the validator's running cache, potentially degrading performance or causing cache thrashing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 38] [LRU Cache Disabled] Setting max_num_nodes_per_lru_cache_shard=0 disables caching - can this cause excessive disk I/O that degrades validator performance when run against a live database? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 33] [Path Canonicalization] Does StorageDirPaths::from_path() canonicalize the path to resolve symlinks and relative paths, or can attackers use non-canonical paths to bypass access controls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 33] [World-Writable Database] If the db_dir has insecure permissions (world-writable), can an attacker replace database files after validation but before opening, causing the tool to read malicious data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 41-44] [Information Disclosure] Can retrieving and printing Transaction data expose sensitive transaction payloads including private contract arguments, user account addresses, or transaction signatures that could be used for phishing attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 41-44] [Privacy Violation] Does printing transaction data include personally identifiable information (PII) or financial data that violates user privacy expectations, especially for private/confidential transaction types? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 41-44] [Error Information Leakage] If get_transaction() returns an error (version not found), does the error message leak information about database internal state, version ranges, or pruning configuration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 43] [Panic on Deserialize] Can malformed transaction data in the database cause get_transaction() to panic during deserialization, crashing the debugging tool and potentially indicating storage corruption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 46-51] [Information Disclosure] Does PersistedAuxiliaryInfo contain consensus-internal metadata (transaction_index within blocks) that could be used to infer validator behavior or identify block proposal patterns? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: run(), Line 46-51] [Version Mismatch] Can requesting PersistedAuxiliaryInfo for versions before it was introduced (based on persisted_auxiliary_info_version feature flag) cause errors or return None, leaking information about when features were activated? (Low)
